content.en: Hardware Trojan detection: Researchers have been exploring various ways to detect hardware Trojans, which are malicious modifications to computer hardware. One approach is to use algorithms and machine learning techniques to analyze hardware layouts, reverse engineer circuits, classify gate-level netlists, and detect logical relationships that may indicate the presence of Trojans. These algorithms, such as Haar feature extractor, AdaBoost learning algorithm, K-means clustering, support vector machine (SVM), and neural network (NN) classifiers, are being used to enhance the detectability of hardware Trojans and improve the overall security of computer systems.
content.da: Hardware Trojan-detektion: Forskere har udforsket forskellige måder at opdage hardware Trojans på, som er ondsindede ændringer i computerhardware. En tilgang er at bruge algoritmer og maskinlæringsteknikker til at analysere hardware-layouts, omvendt konstruere kredsløb, klassificere gate-niveau netlister og opdage logiske relationer, der kan indikere tilstedeværelsen af Trojans. Disse algoritmer, såsom Haar-feature extractor, AdaBoost-læringsalgoritme, K-means clustering, support vector machine (SVM), og neurale netværk (NN) klassifikatorer, anvendes for at forbedre detekterbarheden af hardware Trojans og øge den samlede sikkerhed i computersystemer.
